data.name: The Greater Bay Area Plan
data.desc: The Pearl River Delta in China's south has grown from an agricultural area in 1980 to Asia's largest and most populous urban area.

data.name: How Canadian extradition works
data.desc: Canada has seven steps and three phases required for extradition requests. Extradition in Canada is conducted in conformity with the Extradition Act, international treaties and the Charter of Rights and Freedoms.

data.name: How the Chinese government works

data.name: Extradition procedure in Hong Kong
data.desc: Hong Kong's existing long term extradition agreement is with 20 jurisdictions. The proposed process would open extradition orders to the rest of the world. There are seven steps and three phases involved.

data.desc: The Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau bridge in detail.

data.name: Evolution of the MTR
data.desc: The MTR has nearly doubled in size since 1998. Check out how here.

data.name: How criminals scam Hongkongers
data.desc: Criminals used phone and online scams to steal HK$1.36 billion (US$174 million) from Hong Kong victims in 2017, according to police. Just a year earlier, Hongkongers were duped out of a record HK$2.13 billion. Here's how the scams work.

data.name: Pollution in Hong Kong
data.desc: In 2017, 10,400 people in Hong Kong died from respiratory diseases and nearly 193,000 were taken to hospital, government statistics show. But where is the smog coming from? Click on a polluter in the illustration to discover the sources of pollution in Hong Kong.

data.name: West Kowloon terminus immigration plan
data.desc: Hong Kong has leased parts of the new West Kowloon station to mainland China’s immigration and customs authorities, which have full jurisdiction there. Select a travel direction below to see how the plan will work.

data.name: Land use in Hong Kong
data.desc: Hong Kong is looking for more space to house its future population. It seems the city is starved of space, and regularly earns a name for being crowded and densely populated.

data.desc: This cartogram shows American states coloured to reflect their proportion of trade with China. Select a circle for Republicans, Democrats or both, and click a box to see more.

data.name: Najib's legal woes
data.desc: The former Malaysian Prime Minister Najib Razak faces multiple court trials over his alleged links to the 1 Malaysia Development Berhad financial scandal that resulted in losses of over US$4.5 billion at the state fund. He currently faces 42 criminal charges. If convicted of just a handful, Najib could spend the rest of his life behind bars.
